title: The Displaced: The African country that wants refugees
text:
Video

In 2018 - more than 35,000 people were forced to flee their homes every day - that's one every two seconds.

This story is part of a BBC News series, called "The Displaced" - a selection of stories exploring the human impact of this movement, and how it is changing our world.

Check back next week, Monday 30th September, for our next episode in Vietnam #TheDisplaced

If you have been affected by these issues in Uganda or anywhere else in the world and would like to speak to the BBC, email haveyoursay@bbc.co.uk email haveyoursay@bbc.co.uk

Video by Rachael Thorn and Olivia Lace-Evans
description: Uganda - with more than a million refugees - is renowned for the way it welcomes those fleeing violence.
